title.narrative: Dansk Missionsråd Udviklingsafdeling - NGO call Libanon - 2021-2023

description.narrative: Danish Mission Council Development Department - NGO call Lebanon - 2021-2023 - Young members (15-25) of various religious or belief groups within Lebanon, inclusive of displaced Syrians, Palestinians and Armenians, possess a shared narrative of hope that drives social cohesion and provides an impetus for meaningful civic engagement.
FL §06.32.02.15 Other Initiatives in Asia and the Middle East

title.narrative: Bridging – Readers and viewers receive real-life representations of how cross-cutting ties (i.e. experiences, challenges, interests) bring people together and inform civic change.

title.narrative: Bridging – Viewers are presented with a representation of Lebanese society that exposes and denounces divisive narratives and promotes an alternative vision of inclusiveness, accountability, and hope.

title.narrative: Bridging – Young individuals from various religious or belief groups, inclusive of displaced Syrians, Palestinians and Armenians, are willing to encounter one another in an intentional and respectful manner.
Number of STC participants (by age group, sectarian background and gender)

Bridging – Young members (15-25) of various religious or belief groups within Lebanon, inclusive of displaced Syrians, Palestinians and Armenians, are more inclined to seek out and maintain connection with other demographics with whom they differ ethnically, socially, politically or religiously.

- % that have joined cross-community networks (online groups, community groups, unions, etc.), citing the intervention as a driving force for this decision) - % that believe integration of religious communities/displace-host communities will have a negative effect of them and their family.

target.value:
- 25% that have joined cross-community networks (online groups, community groups, unions, etc.), citing the intervention as a driving force for this decision)
- 30 % that believe integration of religious communities/displace-host communities will have a negative effect of them and their family.

title.narrative: Bonding – Young members (15-25) of various religious or belief groups within Lebanon, inclusive of displaced Syrians, Palestinians and Armenians, are more committed to kinship across ethnic, social, political or religious lines based upon national identity, common values or struggles and/or the shared use of goods and services, seeking to protect people rather than any given religion or belief.
- % that believe that a harmonious society is likely, very likely or certain. - % that believe that people from other sections of society should be encouraged to manifest their religion or belief

target.value: - 35 % that believe that a harmonious society is likely, very likely or certain - 75% that believe that people from other sections of society should be encouraged to manifest their religion or belief

title.narrative: Building – Young members (15-25) of various religious or belief groups within Lebanon, inclusive of displaced Syrians, Palestinians and Armenians more readily engage with one another to (re)build Lebanese society by addressing issues of shared public concern.

- Description of civic engagement initiatives undertaken after intervention as a result of intervention. - % of respondents that seek assistance from members of their own group (religious, political, national) exclusively or mostly when trying to solve an issue of public concern.

target.value: - Description of civic engagement initiatives undertaken after intervention as a result of intervention – NA qualitative. - 55 % of respondents that seek assistance from members of their own group (religious, political, national) exclusively or mostly when trying to solve an issue of public concern.
